results.title: The Nervous system
results.brief_description: A study of the structure of the nervous system of the human being; the following points are given detailed treatment: the nature of a nervous impulse; the pathways and connections of the nervous system; the conditions which set up nervous impulses; their passage from cell to cell; their discharge and resultant activity; reflexes, sensory integration, and activity of the cerebrum.

results.title: The Neglected
results.brief_description: A portrayal of families whose children have come under the protection of community authorities as a result of abuse or neglect. It demonstrates that skilled techniques can change patterns of dangerous and unhealthy family relationships and help unstable human beings achieve acceptable standards of parenthood. The operation of the Child Protective Services is shown, stressing the relationship between supervisor and caseworker. It throws light on the subtle and complex aspects of poverty and shows how these characteristics contribute to the poverty cycle. Points a possible way to break this vicious cycle through the rehabilitation of families.

results.title: The Neatos and the Litterbugs in the mystery of ...
results.creator_credit: Allan Frank Sandler, Little Golden Books, Sandler Institutional Films and Zagreb Film
results.brief_description: Porky, one of the Neatos has won a prize but cannot find the claim ticket. The Neatos clean up the littered community environment in an attempt to find the ticket. Presents the concept of keeping the environment clean and free of rubbish that ultimately becomes pollution. Points out the value of taking care of the home environment before going out into the community.

results.title: The Nearest star [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Arnold Frutkin, Hugh Odishaw, Lothar Wolff, Louis De Rochemont and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description: Portrays the unique and critical role of the sun in the drama of our own planet. Traces the history of man’s study of the sun, and explains how solar towers, rockets, and balloons are used in the study of the sun. Describes the communications system established by the National Bureau of Standards to co-ordinate work on solar disturbances and their enhanced X-radiation and particle streams.

results.title: The Nazi New Order
results.brief_description: This programme concentrates very largely on the propagandist character of film materials; there is much less scope than in some of the other programmes for the study of film as “unwitting testimony”. These political messages of the Nazi regime were put in the newsreels and documentary shorts which were a compulsory accompaniment of any feature film show during the war years. The film shows samples of various types of propaganda materials produced.

results.title: The Navigators: Baudin vs Flinders
results.creator_credit: Klaus Toft, ABC-TV (Australia) and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description: This two-part documentary series celebrates the 200th anniversary of the great voyages of discovery by Matthew Flinders (1774-1814) and Nicolas Baudin (1750-1803), leaders of two separate expeditions, one English, the other French, which were sent out by their governments in 1801 to chart the unknown southern coast of Australia and collect botanical specimens. Britain was intent on remaining the leading maritime power. She also needed somewhere to dump her undesirables and convicts having lost her penal colonies in North America after the War of Independence, while France, stripped of her Canadian colonies by England, was seeking a ‘New France’ in the south. Both nations were also desirous of enhancing their Museum collections with specimens from all the Natural History sciences. Their expeditions ranged the Pacific Ocean and, gradually, their maps defined the elusive southern continent, Terra Australis Incognita. The series focuses on the great hardships faced by the ambitious rival captains and their impressive achievements which have largely been overlooked by history. Narrated by Adrian Mulraney. A companion website is available at: http://www.abc.net.au/navigators

results.title: The Navajo: shepherds of the desert
results.creator_credit: J. Donald McIntyre, Coleman Film Enterprises and Southventure Films
results.brief_description: Describes a day in the life of a typical Navajo family. Shows the family at work, the tending and shearing sheep, rug weaving and the family’s social life.

results.title: The Naughty owlet
results.creator_credit: Gyorgy Varwai, Gyula Macskassy and Hungarofilm
results.brief_description: An animated story of a family of baby owls who live in a hollow tree. One little owl refuses to learn to fly and while his brothers work hard, he spends his time looking at television. One day he is caught outside the nest by a fox and needs desperately to fly to get away. The owl flounders and is almost caught, but with the help of his brothers gets away.

results.title: The Nature of science: how ideas change
results.creator_credit: Dick Larson and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Scientific ideas are shown to be in a continual stage of modification and change. We investigate how and why scientific ideas change and in so doing clarify the criteria used to evaluate them, such as their accuracy, simplicity, productivity and scope. For primary grades.
